page.title: 03The History Of Carsington
page.content: Research and Excavations since 1974 have confirmed that this was the site of a Roman Village and suggest a period of occupation of 250 years until the mid forth century.The Romans were concerned with lead mining from Carsington Pastures and the remains now discovered,confirm the smelting of lead and it's distribution on the nearby road between Buxton and Derby. In the Doomsday Survey Ghersintune(now carsington) was owned by the Earl of Shrewsbury and had 206 inhabitants. Today there are 81 people living in 32 houses.During the reign of Queen Elizabeth 1rst the village came into the possession of Ralph Gell.The gell family still own property in the village.The stone on the village green was brought from another part of the village in 1979.It is believed to have been erected by St Betti in 653 A.D.
